page.title: 04HOMELIFE IN HEANOR TOWN
page.content: A typical Saturday for me is to rise at 8:45 a.m. Breakfast is cereals, a mug of tea and toast, followed by reading the sports and T.V. news in the Sun newspaper. The remaining part of the morning is spent with my brother at a football coaching scheme at a local Sports' Centre whilst my dad goes to work at a builders' merchants in Kirkby in Ashfield. We all arrive home at 1 p.m. for lunch of chips and beans. The afternoon is spent watching T.V. or reading to my sister whilst dad goes to race his pigeons. In the evening after a bath the whole family visit the Sunnyside Working Men's Club where my mum and dad play Bingo whilst Paul and myself play Pool or try to win money on the fruit machine until 11 p.m. when we return home. I am elevan years old.
